oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Henry Driver home being razed, Nashville, Tennessee, 1941 March 19
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A 1941 scene of the razing of the Henry Driver home in Nashville, Tennessee, at 1206 McFerrin Avenue in East Nashville. The original structure was built in 1835. Henry Driver was the brother to Capt. William Driver and the grandfather of Mrs. E. L. Spain of Nashville. Forms part of Record Group 412, Photographs Collection. 1 photograph negative : b & w ; 4 x 5 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Driver family
